Text_Numeracy: I get a lot of information on the internet.  But, a lot of it is pretty generic and doesn't fit my symptoms or questions.  I talk to my Dr about my symptoms.  He gives me test or referrals, but sometimes I just don't think the system is getting my issues solved effectively!
Text_Anxiety: I'm not sure if I trust the Doctor.  Now a days, he checks things off on the computer, while asking me questions.  I can do that!  Is the system good or is the doctor??? I don't know!  ...not sure!!!
Text_TrustPhys: I'm getting older (68).  I can see the world and other people.  In general if you are old something is gonna go wrong sooner or later and actually has.  The proof is in the pudding!
Text_SubjectiveLit: My sister died of a hole in her heart at the age of eight in 1959.  I was about ten .  I learned a lot about the heart and how it works from listening to the adults discuss my sisters problem

Text_Numeracy: I believe I have huge experience in this field, as my wife is ill for couple years and I'm talking to radio and chemo-therapy doctors. Not by choice, but I think I'm pretty capable...
Text_Anxiety: I saw the results of his work and I know I can trust him in terms of whats best for my health. Not sure about what he is charging me for it...
Text_TrustPhys: Recently I worry more about if the doctor will accept my health insurance, than if there is something wrong with me. Also, I'm worrying how much of the bill is my responsibility and how much insurance's.
Text_SubjectiveLit: Like I wrote before... my wife was diagnosed with cervical cancer and we both fought that diseases....  I was on a phone call with all kind of specialists, doctors and technicians...  we got some more experience than we wanted.

Text_Numeracy: Mostly I can figure stuff out, but there are still a lot of questions that go unswered sometimes.  Although they try to explain things to me I still sometimes have a hard time remembering or understanding them.  Doctor information to me is often complicated.
Text_Anxiety: My primary doctor is really good with patients and caring.  I think she has her patient's best interest in her heart.  She is careful not to give me too many pills of the same med.  For example she didn't want to give me any more of the pink blood pressure med, so she gave me a different one so I could have more of what I needed but not too much of one kind.
Text_TrustPhys: My blood pressure is always high and it is even higher when I go to the doctor's office.  I am always anxious because I'm expecting it to be high.
Text_SubjectiveLit: When the doctors told me I have a leaky heart valve they explained to me that my heart was pumping some of the blood backwards, or regurgitating.

Text_Numeracy: I understand most information told to me.I pick up things quickly. Don't usually need any help. I hope this answers the question.
Text_Anxiety: My doctor has taken care of all my family, so he knows our family medical history. I trust his knowledge of medicine to provide the best care possible.
Text_TrustPhys: I don't like needles so I get really paranoid of having blood drawn or getting a shot. And the occasionally long wait to get test results back is an uncomfortable time.
Text_SubjectiveLit: I really don't have an experience to talk about here. This question really doesn't pertain to me. So this is not a relevant question for me.

Text_Numeracy: I feel I am educated enough to either know what the doctor is saying to me upfront or I could research the topic on my own. I feel confident in the health staff to properly explain things to me.
Text_Anxiety: In the past, my doctor has been very receptive to my needs as a patient. He has taken the time to explain to me anything I did not understand.
Text_TrustPhys: I worry about the cost of the care I am receiving.
Text_SubjectiveLit: When I was younger I was diagnosed with testicular cancer. My doctor helped talk me through everything.

Text_Numeracy: I feel that I have full capacity to understand what I need to know regarding my basic medical needs.
Text_Anxiety: My doctor has always been honest and upfront with me and he shows he cares. I couldn't ask for more from him.
Text_TrustPhys: Generally I am not anxious or worried when visiting my doctor because I usually know what to expect.
Text_SubjectiveLit: Due to the fact that I suffer from COPD, emphysema, high blood pressure and congestive heart failure

Text_Numeracy: I confident that I would be able to understand most of the basic health information and services I need from my doctor
Text_Anxiety: The doctors I've gone to are usually right. They've never given any reason for me to not trust them, and they've always been honest with me, even if I didn't want to hear it.
Text_TrustPhys: I've never liked going to the doctor's. They usually just tell things I already know, but it doesn't make me feel any less uncomfortable. I don't think I'll ever be ready the day they tell me something I won't know about my physical condition
Text_SubjectiveLit: I demonstrated my medical knowledge during a test in high school. We learned CPR in my health class and I demonstrated how to proceed to receive a certificate

Text_Numeracy: While I don't know much about medical or health related information, I am generally a smart person. I can figure most things out myself with a little research. If there is something that I don't understand, I have family who I can ask to help me out.
Text_Anxiety: I have been seeing this doctor for years and I trust his judgement. I have never had any issues or problems with him that would make me doubt his ability or honesty. I am comfortable with him as well.
Text_TrustPhys: I am usually worried about the results of a blood test and just making sure my numbers are okay in general.
Text_SubjectiveLit: Years ago I had problems with my stomach. Based on the symptoms, I was pretty sure that I knew what the problem was. After double checking online, I was even more sure, so I went to the doctor. It turns out that I was right and the doctor let me know that it was good that I came in when I did, so he was able to help me.

Text_Numeracy: I feel as though i could identify certain health services/medication necessary to treat a person with the help of a certified doctor in that particular field, or research over the condition, depending on the situation.
Text_Anxiety: I trust my doctor because they never beat around the bush to tell me the truth, and make sure that I'm feeling as good as possible. They always have a way to cheer me up, and lessen painful experiences.
Text_TrustPhys: What makes me feel most anxious about visiting doctors are x-ray scans, and worst of all: shots. I hate needles, and having one in me is something i cannot stand one bit.
Text_SubjectiveLit: My dad was having lower back pain for about a week. He is a gym instructor, so he goes regularly, but i noticed he doesn't strecth like he should prior to beginning workouts. So i asked him if he was flexible in his hips, hamstrings, and IT bands since they can cause lower back pain if non-flexible muscle tissue is too tight. He started stretching those areas everyday and the pain eventually decreased and then went away entirely.

Text_Numeracy: I am okay with it for the most part, but I often forget to ask questions. I usually end up researching it for myself at a later time, because I know doctor's are busy and I don't want to bother them.
Text_Anxiety: I trust my doctor because he is highly trained in his field. But distrust him because most doctors are in the pockets of the pharmaceutical companies.
Text_TrustPhys: I just get nervous having to sit in doctor's offices. I'm afraid of the germs and nervous about the visit itself.
Text_SubjectiveLit: Every time I researched my symptoms myself and self-medicated during the times in my life when I had no insurance. Also, every time my son has been sick.

Text_Numeracy: I think that I am fairly able to do this all by myself. I think I am capable to ask the needed questions. I would need very little or no assistance to get the information that I need.
Text_Anxiety: I have known my physician for a very long time. He was my family doctor for my entire life. He has always had good solutions to all of my problems. He has never failed my family in any aspect.
Text_TrustPhys: The thing that makes me feel the most anxious is not knowing whether something serious is happening or not. I fear the worst but am unable to see whether it is true or not.
Text_SubjectiveLit: I was able to tell a coworker what condition that they might have. They told me about some symptoms that they were experiencing. I was able to help them reach a diagnosis.

Text_Numeracy: I read and re-read all the information.  If I don't understand, I will discuss it with my spouse or other family members.  Then I will ask my Doctor.
Text_Anxiety: He examines me throughly and he runs test if needed.  I see a neurolgist due to a muscle disorder.  I have seen him for the past five years.  He has helped me with every aspect of this disease. Ran every test possible.  Also discussed my diagnosis with other neurologist.   He explains everything so I and my husband completely understand
Text_TrustPhys: The unknown of what they might find from running test.
Text_SubjectiveLit: When I was diagnosis with cerebellar ataxia.  I never heard of this disorder nor did anybody I know.  I have done a lot of research over the past five years including a couple facebook groups.

Text_Numeracy: I think that I would, somewhat competently. I would probably need a little help parsing written information and organizing it all in my help, but I'd probably be able to do most of it myself.
Text_Anxiety: While I do think that they can sometimes be thorough and careful, I do believe that sometimes it's only to fit their hypotheses. I don't firmly stand by that, but I do believe some just want to get patients in and out without so much as a second appointment or a scheduling more exams.
Text_TrustPhys: What kind of tests will they have to do? Will they hurt? Will it be expensive? What if they find something serious? Will I have to have surgery? How will that alter my way of life? Do I have the time in the day to tend to all of this?
Text_SubjectiveLit: I was talking last night with my wife about a medication. I told her that if she were to take that pill and drink grapefruit juice afterwards, it could interact with the medication. In fact, it could amplify the effects. That's why some commercials warn against drinking the juice while on the medication.

Text_Numeracy: I am the head of house  hold and that means I am the only person to make that  decision , to choose whale t ever health care that is possib
Text_Anxiety: i trust my primary dr. because he saved my life when dealing with colon cancer h was very precise when treating me and getting me to the right specialist
Text_TrustPhys: the blood test an how they are going to come back when dealing with cancerit to wait can be very nerving
Text_SubjectiveLit: when i was having a bowel movement at work i had blood in my had blood in my stool , informed the doctor and they found cancer in my colon

Text_Numeracy: I'm not senile.  I can have a dialog with my doctor at any time I go in for a visit.  I have no one to help me with this.
Text_Anxiety: I have a god relationship with all of my doctors.  They always take as much time with me as necessary
Text_TrustPhys: I am not anxious when I go to the doctor.  They take all the time with me as is necessary and I never feel rushed.
Text_SubjectiveLit: I try to understand everything the doctor says and ask questions if if I do not understand.  The doctor always take the time needed.

Text_Numeracy: I believe I have the capacity to understand some of the basics about health care.  The doctors and nurses do not take enough time, though to fully answer questions.  I feel like I'm on an assembly line when I go to the docs\ter.
Text_Anxiety: I never completely trust anyone.  I think that all doctors are purely in it for the money first and patient well being a distant second.
Text_TrustPhys: My biggest fear is that of being told that I have an incurable disease or only have a few months to live.  I think my fear is that my mother died when I was young and my father was very sick as I was growing up.
Text_SubjectiveLit: We were hiking in the backwoods and my friend slipped and cut her hand.  She needed stitches and we were to far out to get help in  time.  I used my sewing kit to sew up her wound.

Text_Numeracy: When it comes to just myself I am confident that I can make the right decisions. Sometimes I may forget my insurance plan numbers or something else but I can definitely ask questions without issue. So even if I am unsure or confused I have no problem making sure I understand before I leave.
Text_Anxiety: I am pretty neutral in general to how a doctor acts or any motivations I am not seeing. Mostly, I just go when I need to. Get seen and checked on. Told what they think is wrong and then get the medication. If it works great. If it does not then back I go to see what could be the issue.
Text_TrustPhys: I actually never get anxious or worried when visiting a doctors office. The doctor is there to make sure I am well. There is no hidden motive involved. They provide a service and I am generally alright with the service I personally receive.
Text_SubjectiveLit: I am not sure if I have the proper knowledge but once I thought I was having something like a heart attack. I was required to take a stress test and it was concluded that I was fine. It may have been extreme pain from something else but it was not my heart. So that would be the most extensive medical anything I have ever undergone at this point in my life.

Text_Numeracy: I usually understand what my doctor or nurse tells me about any conditions that I may have.  If I do not unterstand, my doctor usually takes the time to answer any questions I may have, if I still have questions, there's always Google.
Text_Anxiety: I have had the same PCP for 16 years, and I trust her completely.  She takes time to actually talk to me about anything, from my personal life to any medical issues I might be having.  I never feel rushed during my appointments, like do when I see other physicians.
Text_TrustPhys: That I might be diagnosed with an incurable or deadly disease, if I am having new or strange symptoms.
Text_SubjectiveLit: When my father died from an aortic aneurysm, my mother didn't understand whst happened to him.  I explained to her that since my father had high blood pressure for a very long time, and didn't take any meds for it, the constant pressure against his aorta weakened the walls, and once they have been weakened, it starts to bulge out.  Since there was still a constant high BP, the weakened are "burst", and caused him to bleed out.  The ED physician looked at me, and asked if I was a doctor.  I told him no, but I did go to school to become a RN, but never finished.

Text_Numeracy: I can see and read perfectly fine. I don't like it when the Dr. doesn't give you time to respond to any concern that have arisen while he is talking to you. I almost always feel rushed. And uncertain what was even said. I have had so many come in and start going on about what needs to happen or what is going on right away. They don't give you time to process anything. You might have a question early on and the not hear anything said after that. Or else completely forget the question you had trying to comprehend what is being said.
Text_Anxiety: They get in to mush of a hurry, it feels rushed. They will come in and start discussing what needs to be done and while I'm there I feel like I don't even talk the same language sometimes. I almost always look everything I can remember on line. It helps me figure out what is really going on.
Text_TrustPhys: I have a hard time comprehending people talking at me. I can't focus no matter how hard I try. I usually try remember key words and look up stuff later. They just get so rushed I don't want to be rude and keep interrupting. So I feel useless sometimes. And passed off that after 35 years of the pain no has an explanation.
Text_SubjectiveLit: I have had unknown leg pain most of my life. I injured my back quite a few years ago, and I  have worked in a hospital a few years ago. I have take medical terminology classes. Biology classes. As well as as a few other classes to be a Naturopathic Practitioner.  I have yet to take the Anatomy classes.

Text_Numeracy: Extremely capable of understanding information regarding my health and the decisions associated with it.
Text_Anxiety: I believe we are all humans and humans make mistakes. So, although I trust my doctor they are not perfect.
Text_TrustPhys: The fear of the unknown at times. Awaiting test results anxiously and fearing the worst from them. Just the feeling of being mortal.
Text_SubjectiveLit: When my husband cut his finger, we wrapped it up to stop the bleeding and kept it above his heart until he received medical attention.
